sentences.sContent: To Kierkegaard, the finitude, understood as the body of the self in this paper, and the infinitude, the so-called inward imagination in Kierkegaard s text, is in absolute contradiction.
sentences.sContent_eng: To Kierkegaard, the finitude, understood as the body of the self in this paper, and the infinitude, the so-called inward imagination in Kierkegaard s text, is in absolute contradiction.
sentences.sCn: 克尔恺郭尔认为人的有限性（即本文称为肉身的方面）与人的无限性（一种纵深扩张的想象力）是不可调和的，在具体的生存过程中，这不可调和的两方面转化为必然性与可能性之间的对立。

trans.tranCn: 有限； 限定， 界限
